author: info@kalkinemedia.com (EIN Presswire)
title: Alicia Lyttle Receives Prestigious Top Artificial Intelligence Voice Badge on LinkedIn
text:
EINPresswire.com/ -- In recognition of her contributions to the field of artificial intelligence (AI), Alicia Lyttlehas been awarded the esteemed 'Top Artificial Intelligence Voice' badge on
Alicia Lyttle, a renowned figure in the AI industry, has consistently provided valuable insights and commentary, furthering discussions around the rapidly evolving field of artificial intelligence. Her active participation in LinkedIn's community, where she frequently adds value to posts, engages in insightful debates and shares her expert knowledge, has made her a go-to voice for AI-related topics.
"I carry this badge with pride," Alicia Lyttle stated. "I love AI and how it has and will continue to change the way we operate on a day-to-day basis, and I love talking about it with others." Her passion for AI is not just about the technology itself but also about its impact on everyday life and its potential for future advancements.
The 'Top Artificial Intelligence Voice' badge on LinkedIn is not just an honor but a recognition of thought leadership and influence in the field. It highlights individuals who are not only experts but also actively engage with their community to share knowledge, foster discussions, and challenge conventional thinking.
Alicia's award is a significant milestone in her career and serves to solidify her credibility as a
leading voice in AI. Her insights and contributions are not only valuable to those directly involved in the field but also to a broader audience interested in understanding the implications and opportunities presented by AI.
As AI continues to shape various aspects of our lives, voices like Alicia's are crucial in guiding the conversation and ensuring that the benefits of AI are maximized while addressing the challenges and ethical considerations it presents.
About Alicia Lyttle
Alicia Lyttle, a leader in the field of artificial intelligence, has been at the forefront of AI research and application. With her extensive knowledge and experience, Alicia has been instrumental in bringing together the AI community to share insights and drive innovation. author: Irene Roma
title: üõ´ Mar√≠a Jos√© Su√°rez Escassi | La modelo se va de Espa√±a por sorpresa
text: Mar√≠a Jos√© Su√°rez ha sido, a su pesar, uno de los personajes de este verano 2024 despu√©s de que saliese a la luz que su pareja durante varios a√±os, el jinete √Ålvaro Mu√±oz Escassi, le hab√≠a sido infiel. La modelo y exmiss Espa√±a ha pasado, sin duda, algunas de las semanas m√°s complicadas de su vida, sobre todo al permanecer expuesta bajo el foco medi√°tico, pero ha sacado fuerza de flaqueza y ha conseguido aguantar el tipo y seguir adelante con sus quehaceres. Ahora, Mar√≠a Jos√© Su√°rez ha dejado Espa√±a y ha hecho balance de estos intensos √∫ltimos meses. La sevillana admite que este verano ha mantenido \"charlas interminables\" con sus \"hermanas y cu√±ados\", conversaciones en las que \"por muy dram√°tico que sea el tema\", siempre le hacen bien. Y lo consiguen porque con ellos, afirma, \"siempre acabamos ri√©ndonos\". Y despu√©s del verano que ha tenido la modelo, eso es algo que se obliga a recordarse y, por supuesto, a poner en el lado positivo de la balanza. Y es que la exmiss Espa√±a ha decidido hacer balance de lo que han sido estas √∫ltimas y agitadas semanas tras su ruptura con √Ålvaro Mu√±oz Escassi. Reconoce que se trata de algo que le ha pasado factura, pero prefiere repasar todo lo que le ha ocurrido en estos √∫ltimos meses y percatarse de que la vida no es tan mala como podr√≠a parecer a primera vista. Mar√≠a Jos√© Su√°rez hace estas reflexiones muy lejos de Espa√±a, concretamente en Miami (Estados Unidos), donde vivi√≥ hace tiempo y donde ha decidido escaparse durante unos d√≠as antes de volver a la rutina. All√≠, mirando un precioso amanecer, ha optado por hacer balance de estas √∫ltimas semanas para recordarse cu√°ntas cosas buenas ha disfrutado, como un viaje a Ibiza con amigas, \"conocer gente nueva en Mallorca\", reencontrase \"con viejas amigas en M√°laga\", estar con su hijo y sus sobrinos \"en las playas de C√°diz\", \"terminar la reforma de mi casa\", \"salir a cenar con un amigo al que hace a√±os que no ve√≠a\", \"hacer m√°s deporte que nunca\", \"escuchar m√∫sica a todo lo que da el coche\", preparar proyectos para septiembre y \"un viaje sorpresa a Miami\". El balance es, desde luego, m√°s que positivo, aunque Mar√≠a Jos√© Su√°rez admite que \"todo lo malo que ha venido este verano con fuerza a atropellarme y desestabilizarme\" est√° ah√≠, pero \"ya en la papelera\". As√≠ que opta por quedarse \"con lo bueno, que ha sido mucho\" y prefiere instalarse \"en el presente, en la bandeja de entrada\", porque \"la vida a veces duele, pero el resto del tiempo es maravillosa\", sentencia llena de energ√≠a y optimismo la exmiss Espa√±a.

author: Mary Gilbert, CNN Meteorologist
title: What season is it? Parts of Midwest will see more snow in spring‚Äôs first week than all of winter | National | kitv.com
text: (CNN) ‚Äî It looks like Mother Nature has her seasons mixed up as a potent, far-reaching storm gears up to unload snow, ice and severe thunderstorms on the central US this weekend. In a seasonal role-reversal, back-to-back storms are sending some cities as much snow [as they had all winter](https://www.cnn.com/2024/03/08/weather/winter-warmth-record-climate/index.html). By Friday morning, the first storm was underway, and already dropped a few inches of snow from the northern Plains to the Great Lakes. At least 3 inches of snow covered parts of the Minneapolis-St. Paul metro from Thursday night into Friday morning. Snow will persist through Friday evening over the Great Lakes before the quick-moving storm slides into the Northeast on Saturday. The second storm will arrive in the central US on Sunday. This encore is expected to outperform its predecessor, ushering in widespread, troublesome and longer-lasting impacts. ‚ÄúDisruptions to daily life‚Äù are likely as a result of this storm, the Weather Prediction Center warned on Friday. Snow is likely to spread from the northern Rockies to the Midwest on Sunday as the storm moves from the Rockies into the Plains and strengthens. Winds will become quite gusty as the storm grows. Blowing snow could create very poor visibility, affecting travel on the ground and in the air. Widespread snowfall totals of over half a foot are likely in multiple north-central states. Over a foot of snow is possible where the heaviest snow centers. This far in advance, it‚Äôs difficult to say exactly where these highest totals will occur, but the Dakotas and Minnesota could end up in the bull‚Äôs-eye. Snow will continue to bury the northern US as the storm pushes east on Monday. Minneapolis received less than a foot of snow from December through February ‚Äì 2 feet short of what a typical winter brings. But what it got over the course of three months may be matched ‚Äì or exceeded ‚Äì in a matter of days. A similar scenario could play out in Fargo, North Dakota, and Aberdeen, South Dakota. Sleet and freezing rain will further complicate the snowfall forecast and travel concerns Sunday and Monday. In Iowa, precipitation could start out as snow on Sunday before mixing with sleet and turning over to rain on Monday. The opposite could occur in Nebraska, where Sunday rain could morph into an icy mix and eventually snow on Monday. Ice buildup could make travel treacherous or weigh down power lines to their breaking point. Damaging thunderstorms will rumble to life Unlike the first quick-hitting storm, the storm arriving early next week will create hazards beyond snow. Cold air trailing behind the wide-reaching storm‚Äôs cold front will clash with warm, moist air in place over the South and produce severe thunderstorms Sunday and Monday. The risk on Sunday will affect areas from Texas through Kansas. Damaging thunderstorms are expected to fire up late Sunday afternoon from central Texas to central Kansas and track slowly eastward through the evening. Wind gusts in excess of 60 mph, hail bigger than quarters and a few tornadoes are possible. The bull‚Äôs-eye of severe thunderstorm risk will shift east on Monday and capture parts of the Lower Mississippi Valley and Southeast. Hazardous thunderstorm activity could get underway by Monday afternoon from Texas to Arkansas and expand in scope as storms track east through the evening hours. Severe hazards are once again possible Monday. Thunderstorms will rumble across the South on Tuesday, but the threat for widespread damaging storms appears to be limited. The-CNN-Wire ‚Ñ¢ & ¬© 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: Thomson Reuters
title: Sweden protests to Iraq over death sentence given to Swedish citizen | The Mighty 790 KFGO | KFGO
text:
Fargo, ND, USA / The Mighty 790 KFGO | KFGO Thomson Reuters Jun 13, 2024 | 2:18 PM STOCKHOLM (Reuters) ‚Äì Sweden said on Thursday it had called in Iraq‚Äôs charge d‚Äôaffaires in Stockholm to protest against a death sentence handed down to a Swedish citizen in Iraq.
The foreign ministry said Iraqi authorities had confirmed that one Swedish citizen had been sentenced to death and that it had also received information that one or two other Swedish citizens had been handed the same sentence.
‚ÄúIraq‚Äôs charg√© d‚Äôaffaires was urgently summoned to the Ministry for Foreign Affairs today,‚Äù Swedish Foreign Minister Tobias Billstrom said in a statement.
‚ÄúAt the meeting, Sweden‚Äôs protests against death sentences issued to Swedes in Iraq, and demands that the sentences not be enforced, were conveyed.‚Äù
Billstrom said Sweden opposes the death penalty ‚Äúalways, everywhere and regardless of the circumstances‚Äù.
The foreign ministry did not give any further information.
Daily Aftonbladet reported that the men had been accused of being involved in the shooting of another Swedish citizen in Iraq in January.
(Reporting by Simon Johnson; Editing by Sandra Maler)

author: Mattia Gussoni
text: Tutto confermato: la settimana santa sar√† estrema a causa del passaggio sull'Italia di un insidioso vortice ciclonico, da noi simpaticamente chiamato "Ciclone della Colomba", visto il periodo dell'anno in cui arriver√†. Avremo a che fare con precipitazioni abbondanti, nevose in montagna e con venti molto forti lungo le coste. Saranno tante le regioni ad essere interessate dal maltempo. Ma andiamo con ordine. La settimana che ci porter√† alla Pasqua inizier√† Luned√¨ 25 Marzo nel segno della stabilit√† atmosferica, grazie ad una temporanea rimonta dell'anticiclone africano che garantir√† un discreto soleggiamento su buona parte del Paese. Si tratter√† tuttavia solo di un fuoco di paglia: l'avvicinamento di una poderosa depressione, sospinta da masse d'aria di origine polare, provocher√† infatti un drastico cambiamento del tempo a livello continentale, a partire da Marted√¨ 26 Marzo con le prime precipitazioni al Centro-Nord. Attenzione perch√© le correnti fredde in ingresso dalla Porta del Rodano, favoriranno la formazione di un Ciclone Mediterraneo che dal Golfo del Leone (Francia) si sposter√† rapidamente verso i nostri mari. Appunto, il Ciclone della Colomba. Tra Mercoled√¨ 27 e Gioved√¨ 28 Marzo entreremo nella fase clou di questa ondata di maltempo pre-pasquale: questo tipo di configurazione favorisce lo scontro tra masse d'aria di origine diversa (aria fredda di origine polare e aria calda in risalita dall'Africa) aumentando di conseguenza il rischio di eventi meteo estremi come nubifragi e pericolose grandinate. Sulle Alpi torner√† anche la neve, con fiocchi a partire dai 1400/1500 metri di quota (piuttosto in basso per essere fine Marzo). Al momento, le zone maggiormente a rischio, come confermano gli ultimi aggiornamenti, paiono essere le regioni del Centro-Nord (Mercoled√¨), quelle del versante meridionale tirrenico e le due Isole Maggiori (Gioved√¨). Di questo, tuttavia, avremo modo di riparlare nel corso dei nostri prossimi aggiornamenti.

author: ANI
title: India News | UP: Thousands of Devotees Take Holy Dip at Sangam in Prayagraj on Occasion of Shravan Amvasya
text:
Prayagraj (Uttar Pradesh) [India], July 24 (ANI): A Large number of devotees took a holy dip in the confluence of Rivers Ganga and Yamuna, known as 'Sangam' in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Thursday on the occasion of Shravan Amavasya.
Taking a dip in the holy water on Shravan Amavasya is considered to have special significance, and devotees today, along with chanting and penance, also make donations.
Also Read | PM Modi UK Visit: Indian Diaspora in London Meets PM Narendra Modi, Calls It ‚ÄòSurreal‚Äô and ‚ÄòEmotional‚Äô (Watch Videos).
Even after the flood, a flock of devotees has been reaching at the Sangam point since this morning.
According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the weather in Prayagraj would be "Generally cloudy sky with one or two spells of rain or thundershowers".
Also Read | Parliament Monsoon Session 2025: Lok Sabha to Hold 16-Hour-Long Discussion on Operation Sindoor From July 28; PM Narendra Modi to Participate in Debate, Say Sources.
It also said that the maximum temperature would be 35 degrees and the minimum would be 27 degrees. Humidity is 90 degrees maximum and 70 degrees minimum, as per IMD.
Across various states in India, the auspicious day of Shravan Amavasya is being celebrated. At the Mahakaleshwar Temple in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, priests performed Bhasma Aarti, and devotees prayed with their hands folded.
Moreover, people are also performing prayers to their ancestors and taking a holy dip in the sea at the Thoothukudi Port beach in Tamil Nadu. The devotees are praying for the peace of the departed ancestors and seeking their blessings.
This particular Amavasya, observed on July 24, 2025, is also known as "Hariyali Amavasya".
According to the Hindu tradition, Amavasya is considered a time for ancestral remembrance, and when it falls in Shravan, it carries added power and sanctity.
On this auspicious day, families perform Tarpan, Shraddha, and other rituals to pay homage to their ancestors, seeking their blessings for peace and wellbeing.
People also observe the day by bathing in holy rivers, such as the Ganga, and offering their prayers to Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati. They also do fasting, donate to the needy, and participate in community rituals and temple visits.
The name "Hariyali Amavasya" reflects the lush renewal of life during the monsoon season. It's a symbolic time of fertility, growth, and preparation for the future.
Yesterday, the sacred festival of Sawan Shivratri was celebrated with immense devotion across the country, particularly in Uttar Pradesh, as thousands of devotees and Kanwar pilgrims gathered at prominent Shiva temples to offer prayers and perform rituals.
In Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh, special prayers were conducted at the Shiv Temple of the Kailash Math. The city also witnessed massive footfall at the Shri Kashi Vishwanath Jyotirlinga Temple, one of the most revered Jyotirlingas in India. Long queues of saffron-clad Kanwar pilgrims, many of whom had walked barefoot for days, lined the streets, waiting patiently to catch a glimpse of the deity. They offered their prayers on this spiritually significant day.
In Uttar Pradesh's Baghpat, devotees flocked to the Shree Parshuram Pura Mahadev Mandir to offer their prayers. Devotees thronged the ancient premises from early morning, pouring holy water and milk over the Shivalinga, a ritual symbolic of purification and surrender to Lord Shiva.
Sawan Shivratri, observed during the holy month of Sawan, is considered one of the most auspicious days for worshipping Lord Shiva. Devotees observe fasts, visit temples, and chant Shiva mantras, believing that this day holds the power to absolve sins and fulfil heartfelt desires.
This year, Sawan began on July 11 and will conclude on August 9. It is the fifth month of the Hindu lunar calendar and is considered one of the holiest periods for devotees of Shiva. (ANI)
(The above story is verified and authored by ANI staff, ANI is South Asia's leading multimedia news agency with over 100 bureaus in India, South Asia and across the globe. ANI brings the latest news on Politics and Current Affairs in India & around the World, Sports, Health, Fitness, Entertainment, & News. The views appearing in the above post do not reflect the opinions of LatestLY)

author: Ishita Roy
title: Paris Hilton Says She Is "New To Parenting" After Parenting Police Schooled Her | Times Now
text: Paris Hilton found herself under scrutiny once again after the ‚Äúparenting police‚Äù criticised her for not putting a life jacket on her son, Phoenix Barron Hilton Reum, during a recent outing at sea. The 43-year-old reality star had shared a TikTok video featuring her 1-year-old son exploring a luxury Sunreef catamaran during a vacation in France last month. What Is In The Video? In the video, Phoenix is seen happily wandering around the catamaran in a burgundy shirt and matching shorts as the boat cruised over the water. He walked across the deck, crawled on the mesh netting above the water, and even called out \"Mama\" as he climbed down a few steps. While the video captured a joyful moment, several followers expressed concern about the toddler‚Äôs safety, as he was not wearing a life jacket during the excursion. One concerned fan commented, \"Momma, please have him wear a life jacket always on a boat!! Stuff happens. That‚Äôs why they‚Äôre called accidents. With love.\" Another added, \"My anxiety not seeing him in a life jacket! Can never be too safe on the water!\" A string of similar comments flooded the post, with followers urging Hilton to prioritize her son's safety. What Was Paris Hilton's Response? On Thursday, Hilton responded to the criticism by explaining that both she and her husband, Carter Reum, had been closely monitoring Phoenix throughout the outing. \"Hey Mamma‚Äôs, thank you for the advice & always caring about my #CutesieCrew. It‚Äôs a big boat & my husband and I are following him around everywhere & watching like hawks. My babies are my world!\" she wrote in the comments section. Also Read: Here Are Five Things You Can Learn From Sourav Ganguly's Parenting Style Previous Incidents This isn't the first time Hilton has faced backlash over her parenting decisions. Earlier in May, Hilton shared a TikTok video of herself playing with Phoenix in the water, but followers quickly pointed out that the safety vest her son was wearing was incorrectly fastened backward. Hilton responded with humour, acknowledging the mistake and reassuring fans that she had the situation under control. \"Oops! Thank you! I never let him out of my arms. Thought it was backward too, I said that to the person whom I bought it from & they said it was on right,\" she replied. Hilton has also been criticised for improperly harnessing her children in car seats. After receiving feedback from her followers, the socialite posted an update, showing that she had corrected the issue and expressed gratitude for the advice. \"Thanks for the mom advice, I'm new to this,\" Hilton wrote. Paris Hilton and Carter Reum, who married in November 2021, welcomed their son Phoenix via surrogate in February 2023 and recently revealed they also welcomed a daughter, London, with the help of a surrogate. Hilton, who has been eagerly embracing motherhood, had previously shared her excitement about starting a family and balancing her career and personal life. Get Latest News Live on Times Now along with Breaking News and Top Headlines from Parents, Lifestyle and around the world.
